Package CCS

Class Parser

java.lang.Object
CCS.Parser
public class Parser extends Object
Used by the Collection class to parse a Collection.
You might want to use the Collection class instead.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Mika Thein
See Also:
  • Collection

  • InvalidObjectException

  • Method Details

    • strip

      public static String strip(String str)
      Translates the given string into useful text to read the given Collection. (Removes unnecessary text like comments, line breaks, tabs or text outside of the brackets.)
      Parameters:
      str - Unparsed Collection in text notation.
      Returns:
      A clear text notation of the Collection without useless passages.

    • split

      public static String[] split(String str, char d)
      Splits a string at every delimiter outside of quotes and Collections.
      Parameters:
      str - The input string.
      d - The delimiter.
      Returns:
      An array out of resulting elements.

    • fillRaw

      public static void fillRaw(String stripped, HashMap<String,String> rawContentMap)
      Fills a HashMap with the content of a Collection.
      Parameters:
      stripped - The Collection in text notation and stripped.
      rawContentMap - The HashMap which is supposed to be filled.
      Throws:
      InvalidSyntaxException - If a key is invalid or exists multiple times.
      See Also:
      • strip(String)

    • prepareString

      public static String prepareString(String str)
      Prepares a String for being placed into a Collection.
      (Converts backslash escapes: \", \\, \n, \r, \b, \t and \f.)
      Parameters:
      str - The original String.
      Returns:
      The prepared String.
      See Also:

    • decodeString

      public static String decodeString(String str)

      (Converts backslash escapes: \", \\, \n, \r, \b, \t and \f.)
      Parameters:
      str - The "prepared" String.
      Returns:
      The original String.

    • isValidKey

      public static boolean isValidKey(String key)
      A valid key matches the following regular expression: "[a-zA-Z_\- ]+".
      Parameters:
      key - The key.
      Returns:
      Whether the key is a valid key.

    • getNumType

      Parameters:

      Returns:
